page.title: 02CAMMO ESTATE
page.content: Cammo Estate was first recorded in the 14th Century and after many years of development and change it was feud to Edinburgh District Council in 1980. The Estate consists of about 75 acres of farmland and 25 acres of woodland. It is intended that it will be developed as wildlife woodland in a parkland setting which may be enjoyed by the general public and may be used as a teaching resource. Much work has already been done to clear the dereliction of years and tree planting is well under way. The children of Primary 6, Clermiston School, visited the woodland to watch a special ceremony at which the Lord Provost, wearing his official gold chain, planted a commemorative tree using a silver spade. When the tree planting is complete, 20000 trees will have been planted over 12 acres.
